result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Leonard Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.
The State moves to amend count 1 to misdemeanor possess THC, contrary to Section 961.41(3g)(e).  Motion granted.
The State moves to delete the repeater enhancers on count 2 and 7.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 1, possess THC. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 2, bail jumping. Convicted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 7, resist/obstruct officer. Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 3, 4, 5 and 6.  Motion granted.
The Court sentences the defendant to the Manitowoc County Jail for ninety (90) days, on each count, concurrent, time served.
The defendant has credit for 100 days.
$1,003.00 court costs imposed, to be paid by 08-13-22 or 20 days county jail for failure to pay.
DNA sample ordered.
Minutes.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.    
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.   Jury Calendar.   Offer deadline with DA is set for 06-03-22 at 8:30 a.m.  Scheduling conference is set for 07-13-22 at 10:50 a.m.   
Minutes.

2:00 PM Defendant Anthony Leonard Porter appeared by video, in custody.    Attorney Michael Ross Blum appeared by video for Anthony Leonard Porter. Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Blum was just recently appointed to represent the Defendant in this matter, and after speaking with his client briefly, defense is requesting additional time to review the file and speak with his client.  Court finds good cause to waive time limits in which to conduct a preliminary examination.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Attorney Michael Blum is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county pursuant to the standard collection practices of the Manitowoc County Clerk of Courts Office.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney;  Affidavit of Indigency.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Leonard Porter appeared by video, in custody. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Court tolls time limits. 
Preliminary hearing reset to 05-05-2022 at 2:00pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Order Allowing Withdrawal of Counsel

2:50 PM Defendant Anthony Leonard Porter appeared by video, in custody.  Special appearance by Attorney Luke Harrison by video for Anthony Leonard Porter.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court permits Attorney Cortes to withdraw. Court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

2:45 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Leonard Porter appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Nathan Heim appearing in court for defendant.  Attorney Cortes was appointed on this matter but has filed a motion to withdraw.  The Court reviews the motion and grants it.  Attorney Heim indicates that another attorney will be appointed on this matter.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Order Denying Defendant's Motion. 
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bail is hereby denied.

3:14 pm - Ass't. D.A., Angelina Scarpelli, appearing for the State of Wisconsin, by video.  Defendant, Anthony Porter, appearing in custody at Manitowoc County Jail, by video.  Attorney Cortes asked for this matter be adjourned due to her being ill.  Initial appearance is reset to 03-28-22 at 2:15 p.m.  Defendant file a bail motion and would like to argue that himself.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The defendant argues the motion.  The State objects to any modification.
Due to the fact the defendant has 5 outstanding warrants in other counties, the Court denies the motion.  State to draft order.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Nelida Cortes, through Public Defender.
Nelida Cortes, through Public Defender.
Letter requesting lower bail.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 03-21-22 at 2:15 p.m.   
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Re:  Possess THC, 2nd and subsequent offense, on 03-05-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 3 cts. obstruct officer, 5 cts. misdemeanor bail jumping and possess THC.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is to have no contact with co-defendant Amya Brown, and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
